_header: In May when every heart is light
Subjects: birds, as narrators; May, songs of
_description: Lament for death of Edward IV — fifteen 8-line stanzas

CULGg427.First Lines:
In may whan euery herte is lyȝtAnd flourrys fresschely sprede
                    & sprynge…
CULGg427.Last Lines:
…þat wele not fayle in non distresseEn dieu maffie
                        Gauȝ departer Amen

BLHar3952.Transcription:
In may whan euery herte is lyghteAnd fayr flourys doþ sprede
                    & springI rese me up by fore the daye bryghtefor to heyre the
                    birddis syngI herd a dreofull lamentingeOff lad[yes] as was
                    ware Cloth[yd] in blake…
BLHar3952.Note:
Added by a sixteenth-century hand with other pentrials of first line and
                    title; 6 lines only.
